Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.observer.LambdaObservable<Transmittable>
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Game
public class Game
extends LambdaObservable<Transmittable>
This class is the game and its main purpose is to keep the general state of the match. It provides methods to gain insights on the current state.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    (package private) static class  Game.GameState
    All the possible states of the game

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private boolean active
    True if the game is still going on
    private java.util.List<GodCard> availableGods
    The list of all the gods in game

    The Board object of the game

    The Turn object representing the current game turn

    The current state of the game

    The last round of turns, ordered by oldest to newest.

    The number of maximum players of the game
    private java.util.LinkedList<Player> players
    The participating players, in order
    private BidirectionalMap<User,​Player> subscribedUsers
    The mapping from the User to its relative Player instance

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game​(int numberOfPlayers)
      The class constructor
      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - the number of players

  • Method Details

    • subscribeUser

      public void subscribeUser​(User user)
      This method takes the user and creates the Player. The two instances are added to the subscribedUsers list attribute.
      Parameters:
      user - the representation of the user

    • unsubscribeUser

      public void unsubscribeUser​(User user)
      This method removes the Player from the game by its User. This deletes the entry from the subscribedUsers map and decreases the number of players in game
      Parameters:
      user - the user to remove from the game

    • getPlayersList

      public java.util.List<Player> getPlayersList()
      Gets a List of the players that are currently still playing the game. (i.e. they've not lost yet) The order provided is the same as the playing order, from first to last
      Returns:
      the List of players of this game

    • getLastRoundTurnsList

      public java.util.List<Turn> getLastRoundTurnsList()
      Gets a list of the Turns of the last round.
      Returns:
      the list of the turns of the last round

    • addNewTurn

      public Turn addNewTurn​(Player player)
      Adds new turn to the round, replacing the precedent turn belonging to the player This method automatically resizes the lastRound Map in order to match the number of players still in the game.
      Parameters:
      player - the player that is playing the turn
      Returns:
      the turn

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Gets the board.
      Returns:
      the board

    • setWorkerCell

      public void setWorkerCell​(Worker worker, Cell cell)
      Move a worker to a specific cell. IMPORTANT! If the target cell is occupied, this function expects to be called again to perform the swap between the workers, otherwise it will lead to an inconsistent state!
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker
      cell - the cell

    • buildInCell

      public void buildInCell​(Worker worker, Cell cell, Component component, int builtLevel)
      Builds a component on a cell on behalf of the worker.
      Parameters:
      worker - the building worker
      cell - the cell to build on
      component - the component to be built
      builtLevel - the built level

    • isValidMove

      public boolean isValidMove​(int sourceCellX, int sourceCellY, int targetCellX, int targetCellY, WorkerID performer, User user)
      Checks if the PlayerMoveCommand can be executed
      Parameters:
      sourceCellX - The x coordinate of the cell from which the worker moved
      sourceCellY - The y coordinate of the cell from which the worker moved
      targetCellX - The x coordinate of the cell to which the worker moved
      targetCellY - The y coordinate of the cell to which the worker moved
      performer - The worker who performed the move
      user - the user that triggered the command
      Returns:
      true if the command is valid, false otherwise

    • move

      public void move​(int targetCellX, int targetCellY, WorkerID performer, User user)
      Executes the PlayerMoveCommand
      Parameters:
      targetCellX - The x coordinate of the cell to which the worker moved
      targetCellY - The y coordinate of the cell to which the worker moved
      performer - The worker who performed the move
      user - the user that triggered the command

    • isValidBuild

      public boolean isValidBuild​(int targetCellX, int targetCellY, Component component, WorkerID performer, User user)
      Checks if the PlayerBuildCommand can be executed
      Parameters:
      targetCellX - The x coordinate of the cell on which the worker built
      targetCellY - The y coordinate of the cell on which the worker built
      component - The component built on the cell
      performer - The worker who performed the build
      user - the user that triggered the command
      Returns:
      true if the command is valid, false otherwise
